intro: Stachytarpheta bicolor, commonly known as purpletop vervain, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking purple and white flower clusters that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in moist, sunny environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped with a hairy texture, and it produces small, four-lobed fruits that contain numerous seeds. Stachytarpheta bicolor is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
